item.title: Office Hours
item.description: Schedule and location for Professor Dr von Igelfeld's office hours.

item.title: Urban Vulnerability Assessment for Pandemic Surveillance—The COVID-19 Case in Bogotá, Colombia
item.description: The Urban Vulnerability Assessment (UVA) is a methodology to identify areas most at risk during pandemics by analyzing factors like urban density, poverty, and informal labor. Applied to Bogotá, Colombia during COVID-19, it helps prioritize surveillance and supports disaster risk reduction policies across scales and under resource-constrained scenarios.

item.title: INFEKTA—An agent-based model for transmission of infectious diseases: The COVID-19 case in Bogotá, Colombia
item.description: INFEKTA is an agent-based model that simulates infectious disease spread, including COVID-19, by integrating demographic data and mobility patterns within urban spaces. Applied to Bogotá, Colombia it shows that moderate social distancing (e.g., closing 40% of locations) can effectively reduce transmission, supporting data-driven public health policy decisions.

item.title: List of Irregular Verbs Across Romance Languages
item.description: This dataset contains all irregular verbs in known Romance languages.

item.title: Lectures at the Villa of Reduced Circumstances
item.description: This graduate course presents classical results in Romance philology.

item.title: Portugese Irregular Verbs
item.description: This book discusses Portugese irregular verbs in great details.

item.title: Profanity in Early Irish
item.description: This undergraduate course discusses profanity in Early Irish.
